info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 1:23AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montgomery and northeastern Chester Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 122 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chester Springs, or near West Chester, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norristown, Phoenixville, West Norriton, Conshohocken, Collegeville, Royersford, Trappe, Lionville-Marchwood, Valley Forge, Paoli, Chester Springs, Lionville, King Of Prussia, Plymouth Meeting, Bridgeport, Spring City, Malvern, West Conshohocken, Eagleville and Devon-Berwyn. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 313 and 332. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 330. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 17 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
